message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with the problem of 3D face reconstruction from a single 2D image, which is a classic problem in computer vision and graphics. The method proposed in the paper involves using a coarse-to-fine optimization strategy to generate a smooth coarse 3D face, refine it using local corrective deformation fields, and recover fine geometric details using shape-from-shading. This involves techniques from computer vision (e.g., landmark detection, photometric consistency constraints, shape-from-shading), computer graphics (e.g., 3D face modeling, deformation fields), and machine learning (e.g., example-based bilinear face model). Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). Other likely sub-categories include cs.GR (Computer Graphics), cs.MM (Multimedia), cs.LG (Machine Learning), and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), as the paper involves techniques and methods from these areas as well.
